page.title: 14NAZEING LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THE OWNERS OF THE TWO LARGEST ESTATES IN NAZEING WERE STAUNCHLY ROYALIST WHILST THE YEOMAN FARMERS OF THE VILLAGE SUPPORTED THE ROUNDHEADS.THIS SPLIT IS HELD BY ONE VILLAGER TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE COOLNESS BETWEEN THE TWO PARTS OF THE VILLAGE IN 1985.PRIOR TO THE COMMONWEALTH CLERGY WERE APPOINTED BY A PATRON.ALLSAINTS,NAZEING WAS HELD WITHIN THE GIFT OF WALTHAM ABBEY AND CONVENT.IN 1648 HOWEVER DAVID LEIGH,A CLERK WAS CHOSEN BY THE VILLAGERS TO BE THE PARISH REGISTRAR.HE PROVED HIS LOYALTY TO THE PROTECTORATE BY THE REMOVAL AND DESTRUCTION OF THE OAK SCREEN,THE ENDS OF WHICH CAN STILL BE SEEN EMBEDDED IN TWO INTERIOR WALLS OF THE CHURCH.
